docTitle.titlePart:
CHARACTERIZATION OF DRUGS AS ANTIOXIDANT
PROPHYLACTICS

byline.affiliation: Pharmacology Group, University of London King's College,

front.div:
Abstract-There
is growing interest in the evaluation of drugs (prescription only medicines and over-the-counter
medicines) as antioxidant prophylactics. Although free radical mechanism in human degenerative diseases is now
generally recognised, the mechanisms of tissue injury in humans are very complex and it may not be possible to
clearly identify the role played by free radicals in the process. This review examines the current evidence to
support the notion that drugs for a particular therapeutic category might possess useful antioxidant capacity hence
rninimising tissue injury due to free radicals.
front.keyword:
Keywords-Free
radicals, Oxidative stress, Human diseases, Antioxidants, Drug design
